intro: Stegolepis celiae, commonly known as the Celia's star-leaf, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in late spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, it thrives in cool, humid environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
